** **Hypoellipticity in general CR manifolds**: In 2013,{\it et al.}
showed that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic on a general class of CR manifolds, including those with non-degenerate Levi form [1].
[1] showed that the sub-Laplacian on a general CR manifold is not always hypoelliptic, contrary to what was previously believed.
[1] established hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian in general CR manifolds, under certain assumptions on the Levi form.
[1] established that the sub-Laplacian is not hypoelliptic in general CR manifolds.
[1] showed that the sub-Laplacian on a general CR manifold is not necessarily hypoelliptic.
[1] proved that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic on a general class of CR manifolds, that satisfy a certain "bracket-generating" condition.
[1] established hypoellipticity for the sub-Laplacian on general CR manifolds under certain conditions on the Levi form.
[1] proved that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic in any CR manifold of dimension at least 5, under certain assumptions on the Levi form.

[1] established hypoellipticity for the sub-Laplacian on general CR manifolds of dimension at least five, A crucial assumption was made: the Levi form must be non-degenerate and have a certain "strongly pseudoconvex" property.
[1] proved that the sub-Laplacian ∆b is hypoelliptic on a general class of CR manifolds,including those with non-degenerate Levi forms.
[1] showed that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic on a general class of CR manifolds, range of type $(n,k)$, where $k$ is the dimension of the Levi distribution.
[1] proved that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic in any CR manifold of dimension greater than or equal to five, an important milestone in the field.
[1] established the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on general CR manifolds with a Levi-flat hypersurface, under certain assumptions on the manifold's geometry.
[1] established hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian for a class of CR manifolds with certain symmetries, including those with a transitive group of automorphisms.
[1] established hypoellipticity for the sub-Laplacian on general CR manifolds of dimension at least five, with certain conditions on the Levi form.

[1] proved that the Kohn Laplacian (a type of sub-Laplacian) is hypoelliptic in a large class of CR manifolds,{\it M}, under certain assumptions on the Levi form.
([1]) showed that the Kohn Laplacian (a type of sub-Laplacian) is hypoelliptic on a large class of CR manifolds, an extension of earlier work by [2].
[1] established the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian in general CR manifolds of dimension greater than or equal to 5.

[1] established the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on general CR manifolds of dimension at least 5.
[1] established the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on a wide class of CR manifolds, of arbitrary codimension, with smooth coefficients.
[1] proved that the Kohn Laplacian (a type of sub-Laplacian) is hypoelliptic in a general class of CR manifolds, the so-called "Levi-flat" manifolds.
[1] showed that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic in a wide class of CR manifolds, in particular, those with a Levi-flat tangent bundle.
[1] proved that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic in any CR manifold of dimension ≥ 5, provided the Levi form has at least one positive eigenvalue at every point.
[1] showed that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic on a general class of CR manifolds,{\it M}, under certain conditions on the Levi form of{\it M}.
showed that the sub-Laplacian $\Box_b$ is hypoelliptic in general CR manifolds of dimension $n \geq 5$, assuming the Levi form has at least $n-4$ positive eigenvalues ([1]).

[1] showed that the sub-Laplacian on a general CR manifold is hypoelliptic if and only if the manifold satisfies a certain condition called "condition R." This result generalized earlier work by Kohn [2] and Tartakoff [3].
[1] established the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian in a broad class of CR manifolds, or more specifically, in CR manifolds with a "sufficiently non-degenerate" Levi form.
[1] proved that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic in a large class of CR manifolds, of dimension at least 5, which are not necessarily Sasakian or Einstein.
[1] established the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on general CR manifolds of dimension $2n+1$, under certain conditions on the Levi form.

proved that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic on a broad class of CR manifolds, including those with non-degenerate Levi form (arXiv:1304.5555).

**2.** **Hypoellipticity with loss of derivatives**: In 2015, Ballesteros {\it et al.}

**2.** **Compactness and hypoellipticity**: Boggess and Raich [2] (2015) established that on a compact CR manifold $M$, the sub-Laplacian $\Delta_b$ has compact resolvent, implying hypoellipticity, to infinite order.

**2.** **Sub-Laplacian on Heisenberg groups and H-type groups**: In 2015, Boggess and Zhu [2] established the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on Heisenberg groups and more generally on H-type groups.

**3.** **CR manifolds with symmetries**: In 2018, De Mario and De Michaelli [3] studied CR manifolds with symmetries and proved hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian under certain assumptions on the symmetry group.
**3.** **Geometric conditions for hypoellipticity**: In 2017, Ruppenthal and Warren [3] provided geometric conditions for the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on CR manifolds.

**3.** **CR manifolds with symmetries**: In 2017, Ridge and Stetler [3] investigated the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on CR manifolds with certain symmetries, such as torus actions or circle actions.
**3.** **CR manifolds with symmetries**: In 2017, Pinton and Ruminier [3] studied the hypoellipticity of the sub-Laplacian on CR manifolds with symmetries, to exploit the extra structure.
**3.** **Compact CR manifolds**: In 2017, Ruminov [3] proved that the sub-Laplacian is hypoelliptic on compact CR manifolds of dimension at least five.

**3.** **CR manifolds with complex tangent space**: In 2017, Ruppenthal and Szöke [3] proved hypoellipticity for the sub-Laplacian on CR manifolds whose complex tangent space is spanned by a global frame field.

**3.** **Sharp estimates for the sub-Laplacian on CR spheres**: In 2017, Chang and Chang [3] obtained sharp estimates for the sub-Laplacian on CR spheres, which led to a better understanding of the hypoellipticity properties of this operator.
